intro: Sida acridentata, commonly known as the prickly sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in loose inflorescences. Its seeds are encased in a fluffy pappus, aiding in wind dispersal. Sida acridentata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments.
